devdoc.details: Contracts relying on this library must initialize SwapUtils.Swap struct then use this library for SwapUtils.Swap struct. Note that this library contains both functions called by users and admins. Admin functions should be protected within contracts using this library.

params.amounts: the amounts of each token to add, in their native precision
params.minToMint: the minimum LP tokens adding this amount of liquidity should mint, otherwise revert. Handy for front-running mitigation allowed addresses. If the pool is not in the guarded launch phase, this parameter will be ignored.
params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to

returns._0: amount of LP token user received

params.user: address you want to calculate withdraw fee of

returns._0: current withdraw fee of the user

params.account: the address that is removing liquidity. required for withdraw fee calculation
params.amount: the amount of LP tokens that would to be burned on withdrawal

returns._0: array of amounts of tokens user will receive

params.dx: the number of tokens to sell. If the token charges a fee on transfers, use the amount that gets transferred after the fee.

returns.dy: the number of tokens the user will get

calculateTokenAmount(SwapUtils.Swap stor.details: This shouldn't be used outside frontends for user estimates.

params.account: address of the account depositing or withdrawing tokens
params.amounts: an array of token amounts to deposit or withdrawal, corresponding to pooledTokens. The amount should be in each pooled token's native precision. If a token charges a fee on transfers, use the amount that gets transferred after the fee.
params.deposit: whether this is a deposit or a withdrawal

returns._0: if deposit was true, total amount of lp token that will be minted and if deposit was false, total amount of lp token that will be burned

params.tokenAmount: the amount to withdraw in the pool's precision

returns._0: the amount of token user will receive
admin balance in the token's precision
the virtual price, scaled to precision of POOL_PRECISION_DECIMALS

removeLiquidity(SwapUtils.Swap storage,u.details: Liquidity can always be removed, even when the pool is paused.

params.amount: the amount of LP tokens to burn
params.minAmounts: the minimum amounts of each token in the pool acceptable for this burn. Useful as a front-running mitigation
params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to

returns._0: amounts of tokens the user received

params.amounts: how much of each token to withdraw
params.maxBurnAmount: the max LP token provider is willing to pay to remove liquidity. Useful as a front-running mitigation.
params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to

returns._0: actual amount of LP tokens burned in the withdrawal

params.minAmount: the minimum amount to withdraw, otherwise revert
params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to
params.tokenAmount: the amount of the lp tokens to burn
params.tokenIndex: the index of the token you want to receive

returns._0: amount chosen token that user received

setAdminFee(SwapUtils.Swap storage,uint2.details: adminFee cannot be higher than 100% of the swap fee

params.newAdminFee: new admin fee to be applied on future transactions

params.newWithdrawFee: new withdraw fee to be applied

setSwapFee(SwapUtils.Swap storage,uint25.details: fee cannot be higher than 1% of each swap

params.newSwapFee: new swap fee to be applied on future transactions

params.dx: the amount of tokens the user wants to sell
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive, or revert.
params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to sell
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to buy

returns._0: amount of token user received on swap

params.self: Swap struct to read from and write to
params.toMint: amount of pool tokens to be minted
params.user: address of the user depositing tokens

params.self: Swap struct to withdraw fees from
params.to: Address to send the fees to

devdoc.title: SwapUtils library

calculateCurrentWithdrawFee(SwapUtils.Sw.notice: Calculate the fee that is applied when the given user withdraws. Withdraw fee decays linearly over WITHDRAW_FEE_DECAY_TIME.

calculateRemoveLiquidity(SwapUtils.Swap.notice: A simple method to calculate amount of each underlying tokens that is returned upon burning given amount of LP tokens

calculateSwap(SwapUtils.Swap storage,uin.notice: Externally calculates a swap between two tokens.

calculateTokenAmount(SwapUtils.Swap stor.notice: A simple method to calculate prices from deposits or withdrawals, excluding fees but including slippage. This is helpful as an input into the various "min" parameters on calls to fight front-running

calculateWithdrawOneToken(SwapUtils.Swap.notice: Calculate the dy, the amount of selected token that user receives and the fee of withdrawing in one token

getAdminBalance(SwapUtils.Swap storage,u.notice: return accumulated amount of admin fees of the token with given index

getDepositTimestamp(SwapUtils.Swap stora.notice: Retrieves the timestamp of last deposit made by the given address

getVirtualPrice(SwapUtils.Swap storage).notice: Get the virtual price, to help calculate profit

removeLiquidity(SwapUtils.Swap storage,u.notice: Burn LP tokens to remove liquidity from the pool.

removeLiquidityImbalance(SwapUtils.Swap.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool, weighted differently than the pool's current balances.

removeLiquidityOneToken(SwapUtils.Swap s.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool all in one token.

setDefaultWithdrawFee(SwapUtils.Swap sto.notice: update the default withdraw fee. This also affects deposits made in the past as well.

swap(SwapUtils.Swap storage,uint8,uint8,.notice: swap two tokens in the pool

updateUserWithdrawFee(SwapUtils.Swap sto.notice: Update the withdraw fee for `user`. If the user is currently not providing liquidity in the pool, sets to default value. If not, recalculate the starting withdraw fee based on the last deposit's time & amount relative to the new deposit.

withdrawAdminFees(SwapUtils.Swap storage.notice: withdraw all admin fees to a given address

userdoc.notice: A library to be used within Swap.sol. Contains functions responsible for custody and AMM functionalities.
